channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Crystal ball: From innovative attacks to attack effectiveness classifier
item.description: This study presents a set of innovative problem-based evasion attacks against well-known Android malware detection systems, which decrease their detection rate by up to 97%.

item.title: Dora: Sampling and Benchmarking for 3D Shape Variational Auto-Encoders
item.description: We present Dora-VAE, a novel approach that enhances VAE reconstruction through our proposed sharp edge sampling strategy and a dual cross-attention mechanism.

item.title: Unity is Strength: Unifying Convolutional and Transformeral Features for Better Person Re-Identification
item.description: We propose a novel fusion framework called FusionReID to unify the strengths of CNNs and Transformers for image-based person ReID.

item.title: Uncertainty-Participation Context Consistency Learning for Semi-supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Semi-supervised semantic segmentation has attracted considerable attention for its ability to mitigate the reliance on extensive labeled data.

item.title: DRT-o1: Optimized Deep Reasoning Translation via Long Chain-of-Thought
item.description: To simulate LLMs' long thought ability in MT, we first mine sentences containing similes or metaphors from existing literature books, and then develop a multi-agent framework to translate these sentences via long thought.

item.title: Tiered Acquisition for Constrained Bayesian Optimization: An Application to Analog Circuits
item.description: Analog circuit design can be considered as an optimization problem with the targeted circuit specifications as constraints.

item.title: Bi-Directional Multi-Scale Graph Dataset Condensation via Information Bottleneck
item.description: The main bottleneck of the above paradigms is whether the effective information of the original graph is fully preserved when consenting to the primary sub-scale (the first of multiple scales), which determines the condensation effect and consistency of all scales.

item.title: Just What You Desire: Constrained Timeline Summarization with Self-Reflection for Enhanced Relevance
item.description: We propose an approach that employs a large language model (LLM) to summarize news articles according to a specified constraint and cluster them to identify key events to include in a constrained timeline.

item.title: Bivariate Matrix-valued Linear Regression (BMLR): Finite-sample performance under Identifiability and Sparsity Assumptions
item.description: This study explores the estimation of parameters in a matrix-valued linear regression model, where the $T$ responses $(Y_t)_{t=1}^T \in \mathbb{R}^{n \times p}$ and predictors $(X_t)_{t=1}^T \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times q}$ satisfy the relationship $Y_t = A^* X_t B^* + E_t$ for all $t = 1, \ldots, T$.

item.title: An Experimental Evaluation of Japanese Tokenizers for Sentiment-Based Text Classification
item.description: This study investigates the performance of three popular tokenization tools: MeCab, Sudachi, and SentencePiece, when applied as a preprocessing step for sentiment-based text classification of Japanese texts.

item.title: CodeV: Issue Resolving with Visual Data
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have advanced rapidly in recent years, with their applications in software engineering expanding to more complex repository-level tasks.

item.title: Chumor 2.0: Towards Benchmarking Chinese Humor Understanding
item.description: Existing humor datasets and evaluations predominantly focus on English, leaving limited resources for culturally nuanced humor in non-English languages like Chinese.

item.title: SMAC-Hard: Enabling Mixed Opponent Strategy Script and Self-play on SMAC
item.description: SMAC-HARD supports customizable opponent strategies, randomization of adversarial policies, and interfaces for MARL self-play, enabling agents to generalize to varying opponent behaviors and improve model stability.

item.title: Scenario-Wise Rec: A Multi-Scenario Recommendation Benchmark
item.description: Multi Scenario Recommendation (MSR) tasks, referring to building a unified model to enhance performance across all recommendation scenarios, have recently gained much attention.

item.title: RAGONITE: Iterative Retrieval on Induced Databases and Verbalized RDF for Conversational QA over KGs with RAG
item.description: Conversational question answering (ConvQA) is a convenient means of searching over RDF knowledge graphs (KGs), where a prevalent approach is to translate natural language questions to SPARQL queries.

item.title: Bayesian penalized empirical likelihood and MCMC sampling
item.description: Our approach has two primary objectives: (i) to enhance the inherent flexibility of EL in accommodating diverse model conditions, and (ii) to facilitate the use of well-established Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) sampling schemes as a convenient alternative to the complex optimization typically required for statistical inference using EL.

item.title: Asynchronous Federated Learning: A Scalable Approach for Decentralized Machine Learning
item.description: However, traditional FL approaches often face limitations in scalability and efficiency due to their reliance on synchronous client updates, which can result in significant delays and increased communication overhead, particularly in heterogeneous and dynamic environments.

item.title: A Dual-Perspective Metaphor Detection Framework Using Large Language Models
item.description: Metaphor detection, a critical task in natural language processing, involves identifying whether a particular word in a sentence is used metaphorically.

item.title: Comprehensive Multi-Modal Prototypes are Simple and Effective Classifiers for Vast-Vocabulary Object Detection
item.description: Enabling models to recognize vast open-world categories has been a longstanding pursuit in object detection.

item.title: Unlocking Cross-Lingual Sentiment Analysis through Emoji Interpretation: A Multimodal Generative AI Approach
item.description: Our analysis reveals that the accuracy of LLM-based emoji-conveyed sentiment is 81. 43%, underscoring emojis' significant potential to serve as a universal sentiment marker.

item.title: S-INF: Towards Realistic Indoor Scene Synthesis via Scene Implicit Neural Field
item.description: It disentangles the multimodal relationships into scene layout relationships and detailed object relationships, fusing them later through implicit neural fields (INFs).

item.title: On the Generalization Ability of Machine-Generated Text Detectors
item.description: The rise of large language models (LLMs) has raised concerns about machine-generated text (MGT), including ethical and practical issues like plagiarism and misinformation.

item.title: Resource-Aware Arabic LLM Creation: Model Adaptation, Integration, and Multi-Domain Testing
item.description: This paper presents a novel approach to fine-tuning the Qwen2-1. 5B model for Arabic language processing using Quantized Low-Rank Adaptation (QLoRA) on a system with only 4GB VRAM.

item.title: ResearchTown: Simulator of Human Research Community
item.description: Our experiments reveal three key findings: (1) ResearchTown can provide a realistic simulation of collaborative research activities, including paper writing and review writing; (2) ResearchTown can maintain robust simulation with multiple researchers and diverse papers; (3) ResearchTown can generate interdisciplinary research ideas that potentially inspire novel research directions.

item.title: Efficient fine-tuning methodology of text embedding models for information retrieval: contrastive learning penalty (clp)
item.description: Text embedding models play a crucial role in natural language processing, particularly in information retrieval, and their importance is further highlighted with the recent utilization of RAG (Retrieval- Augmented Generation).

item.title: Dual Conditioned Motion Diffusion for Pose-Based Video Anomaly Detection
item.description: We address pose-based video anomaly detection and introduce a novel framework called Dual Conditioned Motion Diffusion (DCMD), which enjoys the advantages of both approaches.

item.title: Benchmarking Generative AI Models for Deep Learning Test Input Generation
item.description: Test Input Generators (TIGs) are crucial to assess the ability of Deep Learning (DL) image classifiers to provide correct predictions for inputs beyond their training and test sets.

item.title: LegalAgentBench: Evaluating LLM Agents in Legal Domain
item.description: Therefore, we propose LegalAgentBench, a comprehensive benchmark specifically designed to evaluate LLM Agents in the Chinese legal domain.

item.title: B-STaR: Monitoring and Balancing Exploration and Exploitation in Self-Taught Reasoners
item.description: In the absence of extensive human-annotated data for complex reasoning tasks, self-improvement -- where models are trained on their own outputs -- has emerged as a primary method for enhancing performance.

item.title: YuLan-Mini: An Open Data-efficient Language Model
item.description: Effective pre-training of large language models (LLMs) has been challenging due to the immense resource demands and the complexity of the technical processes involved.

item.title: Interweaving Memories of a Siamese Large Language Model
item.description: A promising approach to mitigate this issue is to recall prior memories based on the original knowledge.

item.title: Modality-Aware Shot Relating and Comparing for Video Scene Detection
item.description: Achieving this requires meticulously correlating multi-modal cues, $\it{e. g.}$ visual entity and place modalities, among shots and comparing semantic changes around each shot.

item.title: Kernel-Aware Graph Prompt Learning for Few-Shot Anomaly Detection
item.description: Specifically, a kernel-aware hierarchical graph is built by taking the different layer features focusing on anomalous regions of different sizes as nodes, meanwhile, the relationships between arbitrary pairs of nodes stand for the edges of the graph.

item.title: xPatch: Dual-Stream Time Series Forecasting with Exponential Seasonal-Trend Decomposition
item.description: In this work, we design eXponential Patch (xPatch for short), a novel dual-stream architecture that utilizes exponential decomposition.

item.title: From Models to Microtheories: Distilling a Model's Topical Knowledge for Grounded Question Answering
item.description: We show that, when added to a general corpus (e. g., Wikipedia), microtheories can supply critical, topical information not necessarily present in the corpus, improving both a model's ability to ground its answers to verifiable knowledge (i. e., show how answers are systematically entailed by documents in the corpus, fully grounding up to +8% more answers), and the accuracy of those grounded answers (up to +8% absolute).

item.title: ActiveGS: Active Scene Reconstruction using Gaussian Splatting
item.description: The core of our framework is an effective confidence modelling technique for the Gaussian splatting map to identify under-reconstructed areas, while utilising spatial information from the voxel map to target unexplored areas and assist in collision-free path planning.

item.title: EPE-P: Evidence-based Parameter-efficient Prompting for Multimodal Learning with Missing Modalities
item.description: Existing methods for managing missing modalities often require the design of separate prompts for each modality or missing case, leading to complex designs and a substantial increase in the number of parameters to be learned.

item.title: Improving Pareto Set Learning for Expensive Multi-objective Optimization via Stein Variational Hypernetworks
item.description: Through extensive experiments across both synthetic and real-world MOO benchmarks, we demonstrate that SVH-PSL significantly improves the quality of the learned Pareto set, offering a promising solution for expensive multi-objective optimization problems.

item.title: Automating the Search for Artificial Life with Foundation Models
item.description: With the recent Nobel Prize awarded for radical advances in protein discovery, foundation models (FMs) for exploring large combinatorial spaces promise to revolutionize many scientific fields.

item.title: Generating Completions for Fragmented Broca's Aphasic Sentences Using Large Language Models
item.description: We first generate synthetic Broca's aphasic data using a rule-based system designed to mirror the linguistic characteristics of Broca's aphasic speech.

item.title: Cross-View Referring Multi-Object Tracking
item.description: It introduces the cross-view to obtain the appearances of objects from multiple views, avoiding the problem of the invisible appearances of objects in RMOT task.

item.title: Friends-MMC: A Dataset for Multi-modal Multi-party Conversation Understanding
item.description: Based on this Friends-MMC dataset, we further study two fundamental MMC tasks: conversation speaker identification and conversation response prediction, both of which have the multi-party nature with the video or image as visual context.

item.title: Rethinking Cancer Gene Identification through Graph Anomaly Analysis
item.description: Graph neural networks (GNNs) have shown promise in integrating protein-protein interaction (PPI) networks for identifying cancer genes in recent studies.

item.title: VarAD: Lightweight High-Resolution Image Anomaly Detection via Visual Autoregressive Modeling
item.description: To tackle HRIAD, this paper translates image anomaly detection into visual token prediction and proposes VarAD based on visual autoregressive modeling for token prediction.

item.title: VidTwin: Video VAE with Decoupled Structure and Dynamics
item.description: Recent advancements in video autoencoders (Video AEs) have significantly improved the quality and efficiency of video generation.

item.title: Power- and Fragmentation-aware Online Scheduling for GPU Datacenters
item.description: A recent scheduling policy, Fragmentation Gradient Descent (FGD), leverages a fragmentation metric to address this issue.

item.title: Enhancing Reconstruction-Based Out-of-Distribution Detection in Brain MRI with Model and Metric Ensembles
item.description: Out-of-distribution (OOD) detection is crucial for safely deploying automated medical image analysis systems, as abnormal patterns in images could hamper their performance.

item.title: Towards An Unsupervised Learning Scheme for Efficiently Solving Parameterized Mixed-Integer Programs
item.description: In this paper, we describe a novel unsupervised learning scheme for accelerating the solution of a family of mixed integer programming (MIP) problems.

item.title: Guided Real Image Dehazing using YCbCr Color Space
item.description: Image dehazing, particularly with learning-based methods, has gained significant attention due to its importance in real-world applications.

item.title: QTSeg: A Query Token-Based Architecture for Efficient 2D Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Conversely, transformer architectures leverage attention mechanisms to excel in handling long-range dependencies.
